page.title: 06A DAY IN THE LIFE OF SARAH
page.content: I don't like getting up in the mornings so my Mum has to pull off my covers before I will get out of bed. My breakfast,rice crispies, is usually ready on the table and I eat it with my Mum, Dad and sister. I sometimes get cross at breakfast because my Dad teases me. I practice my spellings and play with my dog until Mum tells me that it's time to go to school. My older sister Suzanne has to be at the road end earlier than me for her bus to the High School so Mum or Dad take us both by car and I sit and wait for Norman the taxi-driver. I am at school before most of my friends so I wait for them by the hedge. I like Maths at school, but I'm not very good. I have a packed lunch that I bring from home every day. After dinner we do painting or sewing or drama or I go on the computer.
